column1: Why did the duck leave the dancefloor? he didnt want to get down on it.
column3: The word down has two meanings: to get down (dance) and to go down (moving down).
column4: I fell down the stairs and hurt my leg.
column5: The duck landed softly on the ground after its flight.

column1: What do you call a seagull that flies by the bay? a bagel
column3: The word bay refers to a body of water and also means to bark like a dog.
column4: The schooner sailed into the calm bay for a peaceful rest.
column5: The dog began to bay loudly when it saw the mailman approaching.

column1: Whats a pirates worst nightmare? a sunken chest and no booty
column3: The word chest can refer to a box for storing treasures and also refers to the upper front part of the body.
column4: The treasure was hidden in an old chest buried on the island.
column5: He took a deep breath and felt his chest expand.

column1: What website are the germans least likely to laugh at? neingag.
column3: The word nag can mean to annoy someone and can also refer to a type of horse.
column4: She would often nag her husband about fixing the leaky faucet.
column5: The farmer had a lovely nag that he rode to the market each week.
